> 16 hours ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> Tweakscale config includes ladders?  Kerbals are always the same size, so that seems like something that shouldn't be tweakscaled.
> 

Yeah, that might be a bit of an oversight. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> Tweakscale config includes ladders?  Kerbals are always the same size, so that seems like something that shouldn't be tweakscaled.
> 

Length may need to be scaled, however...??

> 
> 
> Just now, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> Length may need to be scaled, however...??
> 

You would just need to use multiple ladders, if you scaled the ladder the bars would probably look too far apart.

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> You would just need to use multiple ladders, if you scaled the ladder the bars would probably look too far apart.
> 

Granted... but then again, the bars would be just aesthetic... If the collider was lenghtened, they should still work as normal  

Plus, i can think of some situations where there might not be anything to ATTACH more ladders to...

**Edited <time datetime="2017-03-27T21:16:41Z" title="03/27/2017 09:16  PM" data-short="7 yr">March 27, 2017</time> by Stone Blue**

> 
> 
> On 3/27/2017 at 5:15 PM, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> Granted... but then again, the bars would be just aesthetic... If the collider was lenghtened, they should still work as normal  
> 
> Plus, i can think of some situations where there might not be anything to ATTACH more ladders to...
> 

You could use 2 block segments, (middle, end) the two ends are just flipped after all.  Repeat the middle block segement to form the longer ladders.  

This can be done with model behavior / part editing in the part-tools or a (very) simple geometry shader.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-03T19:52:35Z" title="06/03/2017 07:52  PM" data-short="7 yr">June 3, 2017</time> by Ruedii**
  
clarification
Hows 1.3.1 going?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Starslinger999 said:
> 
> 
> Hows 1.3.1 going?
> 

I doubt this pack needs updating for 1.3.1.  It's a straight parts pack, and as far as I know there weren't any changes in how parts were built.  (Parts packs are usually immune from needing rework for every update, unless things like wheels or landing legs get worked on.  What needs updates are mods that include code modules.)

[@NecroBones](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105424-necrobones/) updated this a few days ago to 1.3.1 but didn't change the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> thread title.

Thanks NB!
Personally am a big fan of scaling ladders as some of my larger craft need stupid huge extendable ladders and being able to tweak scale them so they are just the right length is really useful
Anyone else have a missing/transparent polygon on the edge of the 3X24 parachute? It's a pretty minor problem, but it bugs me.

I don't really mean to necro this, but is Lithobrake getting updated for 1.5.X?

**Edited <time datetime="2018-11-02T07:06:07Z" title="11/02/2018 07:06  AM" data-short="5 yr">November 2, 2018</time> by CajunInABox**

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, CajunInABox said:
> 
> 
> I don't really mean to necro this, but is Lithobrake getting updated for 1.5.X?
> 

I haven't tested it - but as a parts mod, it probably doesn't need updating.  Try it.
Thanks for making such a nice landing oriented mod! I really wanted better landing legs, and this is it!
Is this "retired" along with the other NecroBones mods?  If so, that's a shame.  I've been using his stuff since it came out - even the elephant engine a time or two.

someone needs to make procedural ladders because I am building an absolutely GARGANTUAN forerunner keyship from halo in ksp(about 173 meters total height and it's still quite miniaturized) and the problem I have is the ship has the crew holding parts in the core of the ship and the ship rests on three huge stilt like legs and none of the laddrs are even CLOSE to long enough for this beast of a ship... btw this is what I am modeling my ship after 

![latest?cb=20080504003421](https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/halo/images/0/08/Keyship.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080504003421)that is what my ship kinda looks like... the real thing is about 25 kilometers tall mine is only 173 meters. that core structure in the center is where the crew modules are on my ship, I tried to make the ladder run down the side of the legs but none of the ladders are big enough... btw I did use a hangar extender mod for my keyship
Hello! Are garages still in mod? I couldn't find them neither in VBA nor in folders ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

Is this working OK in 1.6.1?  Does it work with Restock? I'm on 1.5.1, and trying to move to 1.6.1, and this is one of the mods that seems to have been abandoned a long time ago. I have craft that absolutely depend on the legs and ladders.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Murdabenne said:
> 
> 
> Is this working OK in 1.6.1?  Does it work with Restock? I'm on 1.5.1, and trying to move to 1.6.1, and this is one of the mods that seems to have been abandoned a long time ago. I have craft that absolutely depend on the legs and ladders.
> 

Works fine for me in 1.6.1 - parts mods typically work back ages, so you can generally assume older parts will work for quite a while.   (Wheels and landing legs got reworked a few versions back, and areo got reworked in 1.0, but other than that even \*really\* old parts will generally work.)  I haven't tried with Restock.

Odd - <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> just updated all of NB's mods to 1.6.1 compatibility.  Is NB back or do we have a nice anonymous person to thank?
Hah. Just in time to wonder if it works for 1.7 -- I am guessing that it does given those statements about parts mods.
<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> lists Firespitter as a dependency - which LE Tech doesn't need.
Anyone tried this with 1.8.1 or 1.9.x ?
